text:
What a great new addition to the neighborhood. 
I had the signature fish taco. It was delicious. The menu will beckon me back to eventually sample everything.  
The service was provided by the owned, Manny, who's pride and attention to detail makes this place a must-visit.

Best fish tacos in town hands down. 
Don't forget the horrchata, best I've EVER had.
Manny also never let's us down with his awesome service. New favorite place.
Just discovered this place and these are the best Marisco tacos I've had! Definitely recommend for any locals or visitors. Also had amazing hospitality & service.

AMAZING! So we came and checked this place out because we love authentic seafood and this place outdid itself! The food was sooo good with so much flavor, great portions,service was wonderful and the atmosphere was so chill. Defiantly recommend this place for those who are hungover and those who just want bomb food!

Best fish tacos I've had in forever! Foods fresh and delicious. Can't wait to go again. 
Also excellent service!

Vacationing from out of town. Tried the fish, shrimp, and octopus taco. They all are very good. The octopus is a bit soft for my liking. Overall great food great attentive service. Will def try again the next time in town.

I've been craving a spicy shrimp taco for weeks and I'm so happy I found this place!! Manny, the owner, is very friendly and helpful and recommended the octopus taco. So glad he did!! Tried 3 different tacos and they were all delicious. The inside of the restaurant is very clean and comfortable but I took it to go so I can't speak to the service of the wait staff. Will definitely be back!

When we come into town from LA, we try and eat near downtown all the time now.  The food is cheaper, better, and we are able to support the local community.  This time, we made it to Bajamar on our way back home.  We had an octopus taco, a couple of the fish tacos, and the tilapia ceviche tostada.  It was all incredible.  Not to mention the homemade lemonade there, which was spot on.  

When you can have better fish tacos in Las Vegas than in LA, you're doing something right.
Best shrimp tacos!! Camaron enchilado is the way to go!! Good service and affordable.

ohhhh man this is some great food!  The fish tacos and pulpo are delicious here and the place has a warm welcoming.  If you want to be creative and add shrimp to your quesadilla go for it, Bajamar will accommodate your request.

The fish tacos took me back to my childhood days when i'd go to Ensenada, Mexico with my grandma and eat near the port. Good times...

Thank You Bajamar, we'll be back :)

Cute little place the owner was so nice. We got our food to go. My 11 year old said his Octopus taco was delicious. My husband is in love with the ceviche. The beans and rice where very tasty. This is our new favorite Mexican restaurant

I've been coming to Vegas for years! It's just a 3 hour drive from where I live.  Found out about this restaurant and so glad I did!  The food is A-MAZING and the customer service is excellent!  Definitely will be back !
This place brings a little Baja to Vegas.  Hands down the best fish tacos in town!  Surfed Baja for years and eating their fish tacos brings back memories...

Really good food and the service was great very helpful when it came to choosing my food .The orchata was the best one in town and my favorite was the octopus tacos they were really good .will defiantly recommend .

I found them on uber eats the reviews were amazing and the pictures too I was so excited since I am from the Baja and Obviously I am not expecting the same flavor from there but I had my hopes . I order 2 camaron enchilados and I even specify spiciest possible well it wasn't spicy at all. NOTHING!!! The taste was meh I was looking for salt they didnt put on my order and 1 taco look poor with only 3 small shrimps. The pulpo taco was really good in taste but still was missing the spicy salsa. Personally I didnt like the marlin and gobernador taco I wont comment on those since I havent found any marlin tacos that I like here in the US. Cinnamon taste on the horchata was too much. I think they can improve on the flavors and salsas since they have a fresh "salsa" that is only tomato, cilantro and onion they should add serrano. I will be going to taste the food over there not delivered. Overall I was really excited since I was hungover I thought it was going to be awesome for that but since nothing was spicy the food didn't help and was a huge disappointing.   The delivery and packing of the food was awesome !
Manny welcome to the Boulevard! Manny said his tacos were good and he lied! They turned out to be great! We had the Lucas taco,Gobernador taco, taco de Camaron,and Manny's bomb ass Cameron enchilada!

Delicious new place downtown for Baja style tacos and more! It is tastefully adorned inside with a Baja vibe. Clean, relaxing atmosphere. The shrimp and fish tacos were superb, the yummy horchata is served mason jar style, and they have a kids menu!

Fish tacos are PERFECTION! Best fish tacos I have ever had. All of the ingredients are fresh and the fish, although battered, is not super oily. 

The octopus tacos were delicious as well. The sauce they marinade them in is really tasty, however it does make the tortillas a little messy and soggy. 

Marlin tacos (a la brasa) were our least favorite. They cook it in a tomato sauce that was just a little overwhelming. Not terrible, but not great either.

Months ago I had contacted this spot to see if their beans and rice were vegan and they are!

I had a cheat day (I avoid consuming oil) and decided to head to Bajamar. I was greeted by Manny the owner and he took care of me!

I got a side of beans and rice and he made me some super duper yummy tacos.

Avocado tacos with alllll the fixings. Packed with veggies and creamy fresh avocado. Wow! Make sure you get a side of his hot sauce YUM!!!! 

The beans were packed full of flavor and the rice was nice with corn throughout. 

I took my food to go but I'll have to come back a sit up at the bar area. I bet it's a great place to people watch lol. Manny is a doll and is passionate about food and this nice place. 

Super cute place, go there and support local businesses!

Wow! I only ordered one Bajamar Fish Taco but I can say that it definitely was the best fish taco I've ever had. The sauce is perfect and the taco altogether tasted light and fresh, not heavy or greasy at all. Loved it!

I could try to write some flowing, foodie inspired, snobby review if this place, but I won't. Just come try it. Great find with great food that is incredibly priced, a great vibe to the joint, and a friendly staff. Manny is the head honcho and is just a really nice guy. 

The food is beautiful and tastes as good as it looks, at least what I tried. And sadly, I was flying solo and couldn't try a ton of stuff, but I'll be back to stretch my legs on their menu. There's just too many things that sound too good not to!

My boyfriend and I visited here for lunch before I had to go to work. With the recommendation from my coworker, I decided to stop in and see what he was "taco"ing about. :)

We both had a specialty drink, a shrimp tostada as well as two tacos each and we split the last one. For under I believe 30? Which is steal for the quality of food and detail they put out of that kitchen! Considering they are on LV blvd you should not complain about the prices. especially with how BIG the tacos are and the generous amount of fish given.

Manny is I believe the owner/general manager, but he was also our server! He was pleasant and always had a smile, and welcoming guests everytime they walked in. A couple who would be considered a "regular" who has visited the past couple of days while on vacation... walked in and he greeted them and seem to know what they were gonna order before they order it! How sweet! Manny and my boyfriend got to talking about various things, and how they started and where they are from. He is just an overall wonderful person to talk with. He even walked food over to there rival super burrito... EVEN THEY liked his food! :) 

Boyfriend loved the authenticity of the horchata, the sauces, the fish batter, and the tostada. I loved it all. :)

I will be def coming back, and I will continue to tell people about this spot. They have only been open 4 months, and I hope they are there for the next forty years. 

Come try them out, give a small business a chance to grow, they are hard working just trying to bring good food to vegas!

Bajamar has the best fish tacos!
You cannot get tacos like that even in California.
We had the shrimp tacos and the marlin tacos, both flavorful and delicious. The only thing that would make it better, is beer!
We will be back.
First time here to this restaurant, let me just say everything is delicious! The customer service here with Manny and Jorge is top notch!

Soooooo delicious!!! 
It's absolutely MUST TRY RESTAURANT in Las Vegas if you are looking for some NOT THAT EXPENSIVE FOOD.
For me, it deserves SIX stars!!!
Very good and always nice and clean!! Fish tacos like Ensenada style!! Shrimp enchilados tacos  really good
First time in today and it was so worth it! Great price, fast service and even better tasting food! Highly recommend! And even have $1 off fish tacos on Monday and Tuesday.

If you don't like seafood, I feel bad for you son- you got 99 problems but Bajamar ain't gonna be one! There are tacos, tostadas, and more here, but they all come topped with creatures from the sea. This little gem is snuggled into a vagrant-friendly section of Las Vegas Blvd by the OG stripclub, but it's bright and colorful with friendly staff and fabulously fresh food. 

Grab a trio of tacos or a couple of tostadas and share with a friend- or don't, I won't judge you. The namesake Bajamar fish taco is a solid and tasty go-to but if you like spicy, the pulpo (octopus) enchilado version is even better. The Marlin and Lucas tacos are also recommended, with the cocktails being best for groups. Belly up to the bar and ask Manny what's best!

I first ate here on Wednesday, September 27, 2017 and got the Bajamar fish taco and the shrimp ceviche tostada. Omg it was AMAZING! So fresh and amazing flavors. You can tell the owner and chef takes great care in what he is doing. And then it was SOO good, I ate there again Thursday, Sept 28....yes that's right. It was so good I ate there two days in a row. And if I wasn't going out of town today....I'd probably take my husband there for dinner. What a gem! Do your self a favor and go!

This place is a hidden gem! The octopus taco is fantastic! Manny, the owner is very friendly and humble. The atmosphere is great and the place looks very nice and clean. So glad I ventured out and found this place. Go there now, and be delighted! :)

Service was fast and the place was very clean. I ordered several tacos and they were delicious along with the Jamaica water. The Waiter was very informative and very customer driven. I was in Vegas, from El Paso TX,  on a business trip and drove past Bajamar and decided to stop. I was glad for doing so. I would greatly recommend Bajamar to my colleagues next time they are in Vegas.
Just fucking killer fish tacos. If Jaws the shark were a taco it would be these fish tacos.

Where do I even begin! My fiancé and I are always looking for new places to eat. We came across Bajamar. 
And let me tell you.... we're hooked! We literally have tried all the tacos they have on their menu. Every single one of them was made with love! 
We've been here twice and everything tastes fresh and just like the first time we been there. 
Not only is the food amazing but the service is 120%. Manny made us feel very welcomed and went through the menu with us and gave us his recommendations. Honestly, at this point I feel like we just need to try every single thing on their menu and I'm sure we won't be disappointed. 

Bajamar knows exactly what they're doing! Can't wait to see them grow because we just became regulars!!!!
Best fish tacos, best agua de orchata & best homemade cheesecake I've ever had!! Definitely returning to eat here again!!
The best seafood tacos in Vegas. Super authentic mexican style seafood tacos and super cheap. Worth the drive from anywhere. If you like seafood and tacos, this is the place to go!

Me and my girlfriend left the rest of our friends to try this place out and we didn't regret it at all! I also had fish tacos that didnt make the picture bc i ate them before i had the chance to lol this picture was actually taken in oct 17'... we're in may 18' and i cant stop thinking about how good this food was and how amazing and kind the service was ! The owner talked with us the whole time, and was really great company. He shared a lot about his passion for food and joked with us and really made it a memorable experience (: ill be sure to stop by every time i come to vegas
Best seafood in town. Octopus tacos are my favorite. Monday and Tuesday fish tacos are in special and are delicious. Friendly staff.

Sooooooo good. Seriously. The Cameron enchilado was bomb. Their kids quesadilla was super good too. Loved the service. The recommendations. The environment. They even dimmed the lights for us because of our sleeping baby. Loved everything about this place.

Better than el diamante and las islitas!!! 
Its kind of small inside. But it feels like I am by the beach having a fresh taco
Reviews said 5 stars - TRUTH. Excellent fish tacos. I had one Bajamar and one marlin. Totally different prep and flavors but both outstanding!!
My friend took me here a few months ago and I have been hooked ever since!  The fish tacos are some of the best I've had and the service is amazing.  I highly recommend this place!

I came in here after reading the great reviews of the tacos, but I have to say I was a bit disappointed. i really wanted to get a feel for this place so I got the marlin tacos , the tacos gobernador, shrimp ceviche tostada, and red aguachile tostada. I love and eat mariscos, marlin and shrimp tacos regularly. So having said that I believe the Marin tacos were ok not great. I usually enjoy the tortilla on the crunchier side, these were not. Also the tacos gobernador had too much veggies, and it kind of over powered the shrimp. I also do not like my ceviche sweet. It seemed like their ceviche had ketchup or something so I did not enjoy the shrimp ceviche . On the other hand I think the red aguachile was great!

Damn those pulpo tacos tho! I don't understand how people can eat tako at sushi joints when there is pulpo prepared the Mexican way! It's so tender and juicy and it reminds me of the skin and fat of buffalo wings (none of that pesky chicken meat) but octopus is actually very low in fat! How do they cook it like that?

My friend invited to for lunch, and she got two pulpo tacos and one fish. I got one pulpo, one fish, and one shrimp. I should have just gotten all three pulpo. The fish and shrimp was good, but not mind blowingly better than other places I've had. But the octopus! Not only have I not seen it on menus as a hot dish or taco, but it was also prepared so well, with a crispy, yet not hard shell tortilla, and fresh cabbage/tomato/chipotle cream. Everything about it was perfect.

The chef/owner? was extremely nice and remembered my friend. She spilled some sauce on her white pants and asked for some soda water to try to clean it up. He didn't have any, so he went to the Super Burrito place across the lot and got some for her there. What service!

The only thing is it's a little pricey, but it is in the normal part of downtown and not the ghetto. It's across from Viva Las Arepas. Parking is easy, and more parking in the back as well. The inside is very bright and clean. Doesn't look or feel like a dive, though I'm not at all against going to those places either. Def gonna be back!
My first time here , awesome Customer service , food tastes delicious! I would without a doubt recommend this restaurant!

I wanted to give it 4 stars. I mean, how many 5 star reviews can a place have? All those 5-stars make me highly suspicious, especially after reading an article about fake reviews recently. It can't really be all 5 stars, right?!

Well.... 

It's 5 stars. It's 5 stars of delicious awesomeness.

We arrived at 5 pm on a Friday based on Yelp reviews. There were only two other people eating and I wondered if Yelp had failed us. 

Manny, the owner, has a knack for creating tasty masterpieces and excellent customer service. 

I asked for a recommendation and quickly ordered his first suggestion, the pulpo taco and a horchata. My friend, who is less familiar with seafood tacos, decided on  the fish. As we hesitated with our second choices, Manny suggested he put in the order and then order more if we want. 

He was very accommodating, even when my friend ambiguously declared she didn't like "something" on her first taco. He made her next taco with no crema, but then obligingly gave her two sides of it to try. She then fell in love with the chipotle crema and he won her over.

Overall, a great experience. I'd love to  try the rest of the menu. A few recipes may need some tweaking, but they clearly know what they're doing when it comes to cooking the seafood. Since I'm just passing through town, I'd love to see their clientele grow so it's here when I return!


THE FOOD

Lucas Taco (shrimp and california chile)
Absolute favorite for both of us! Think Chile Rellano with perfectly flavored shrimp. My biggest disappointment was that it fell apart and I was forced to eat it with a fork. 

Pulpo (octopus)
The meat was tender and not tough. I've rarely had such well-cooked octopus in the US. Delicious, but be warned - the tortilla is lightly grilled in a LOT of oil / butter. It was dripping.

Gobernador Taco (shrimp and cheese)
More of the perfect shrimp! With cheese!

Bajamar Fish Taco 
Sadly, this was the least favorite for both of us. The batter on the fish was a bit soggy, but I suspect that wasn't the norm. Even assuming it's usually better, it would still be just above mediocre. 

Horchata
This might have been an amazing 5-star horchata, but I was so busy with my tacos I hardly paid attention. Overall, a very solid, classic recipe - well balanced sweet, cinnamon, and creamy.
Been everywhere on the West Coast to places that supposedly have the best tacos.....Bajamar blows away ALL of them!

Hidden gem!!! When we went, it was 4pm and no one else was eating but that's okay cause we got our food very quickly.

We ordered the octopus tostada, fish tacos, octopus tacos, the raw shrimp taco, and chicken fingers and fries.  Everything was sooooo delicious that we ended  up ordering some to go! Best tostada I've tasted!! 

I can't wait to eat here again when I'm visiting Vegas.

FISH TACOS. Must I say more. I came in on a Tuesday. Or what the cold kids call it taco Tuesday. The fish tacos were $2.50 a dollar cheaper than on any other day. I walk in and the set up is a little strange the door is by the bar where the kitchen is and then there are tables off to the side but if you sit at the tables the waiter cannot see you so I opted for the bar. They don't sell any form of alcohol but I believe they are going to change that soon.

The menu is one sided but has a good amount of stuff mostly seafood. I got 3 fish tacos ($2.50)and 1 octopus taco ($4)and a side of rice and beans ($2 each) the food came out fast and it tasted very fresh. The fish itself was crisp and very light. The slaw was also crisp and cooling against the chipotle crema. The octopus taco was the bomb tho. It had crispy cheese and spicy octopus with the same vibrant slaw from the fish taco. Just delicious. The rice and beans were a perfect companion for the tacos. The rice was nicely seasoned and the beans were hearty and covered in cheese.

Overall a pleasant place to spend an evening and if you have a craving for seafood tacos this is the place to go.

Dare I say it...the best fish tacos in Vegas! Yes, I know, Vegas isn't exactly a fish taco destination, but still! These tacos are on point!

My love and I first came in needing a quick bite to eat in the area. Bajamar had been referred to me by a couple different people at this point, and I knew there were a few items I wanted to try. Needless to say, they did not disappoint. You know it's good when on your first visit, you're already thinking of coming back and bringing other people that will enjoy the experience as well.

After two visits now, we've had the opportunity to try the Raw Shrimp Ceviche Tostada, Mixed Seafood Soup, as well as ALL of the fish and seafood tacos, which include:
Pulpo Enchilado Taco
Marlin Taco a Las Brasas
Bajamar Fish Taco
Camaron Enchilado Taco
Gobernador Taco
Carne Asada Taco
Lucas Taco

The seafood soup was certainly good, but I think I'd stick to tacos as my main meal. What did stand out was the Pulpo Enchilado Taco, where wonderfully tender octopus finds a rightful home. The tacos tend to be dressed in a few similar fashions. A closer look reveals that there are 4 shrimp options, one octopus, one battered fish, and one grilled fish option. They are all really good, and there isn't one I'd shy away from ordering. I'm interested in trying some of the appetizers as well next time to see how far the excellence extends. If a cool lager is not your idea of a perfect taco pairing then you could explore one of the Aqua Frescas they offer: Hibiscus Lemonade and Horchata.

It's as if the whole building was plucked up from Baja California and transplanted right here in Vegas, with bright colors and aesthetics that take you ocean-side right away. Inside you'll find a bar with a few beers on tap. Sitting here allows you to engage with Manny, a proud and friendly owner. There are also a handful of tables and a few high-tops in the long, skinny space. A code to get in the bathroom reminds you of your actual setting in Vegas, but also ensures a much cleaner facility to use while at Bajamar.

Return visits will certainly happen for us...we even have some more friends in mind that need to experience Bajamar Seafood & Tacos.
Ate here with my wife today before the Golden Knights game.  We each had a fish taco and a shrimp taco.  Both were excellent and the Gobernador taco was awesome!!  We will definitely come back.
Never had anything like this. The tacos are extremely delicious. Best seafood tacos in town!! Highly recommend

Ohh my Gahhh what a great find! The Spicy shrimp, Octopus and Chile Relleno taco you must try. Those are my top 3, enough said!!! 
This place came as a strong recommendation from an old friend so I knew I had to try it. 

Cuisine: My Top 3 tacos are the Spicy shrimp, Octopus and Chile Relleno tacos. The spicy shrimp and Octopus being the top two. They each have a nice creamy sauce topped to them which I love. I've had the fish taco while it was good I wasn't crazy about it since the fish was deep fried but maybe that's for you. Now as far as a drink you MUST have the Hibiscus lemonade, the dark one. It is wonderfully tart and a nice addition to the tacos. I can't get enough of this drink and I guarantee you'll love it. 
Customer service: It seems the same man is always working there every time I go and I certainly have nothing to complain about as he is attentive and friendly as well as his knowledge of the menu he can recommend anything to you that you may be in the mood for. 
Location: Located in a very small parking lot which probably holds about five or six cars facing Las Vegas Blvd near Lovett's custard. 
Ambiance: I really can't complain, they keep the place clean and have good music. Also plenty of paper towels at your disposal at the table!

I am a lucky monkey to have them a block away from my house. Best shrimp in Las Vegas. Huge and always perfectly cooked. Not a bad item on the menu.  Very reasonably priced for how full they pack the tacos. May just be my favorite local restaurant in town...

All my past experience has been with tacos to go.

Finally made it to @BajamarLV to eat on-premise right off the line. These tacos are really good.

We had the Shrimp Ceviche Tostada, Sauteed Shrimp Taco, Sauteed Octopus Taco and one off the menu Sauteed Marlin Taco. At first I thought I liked the Octopus taco the most but the truth is everything was done really well. From perfectly crisped tortillas on the flattop to the fish and even the limes were super juicy (Nothing I hate more then someone give me a three day old dried up lime with my taco or tequila).

This is an owner operated establishment and the owner we met cares. Love that. If you are in the mood for a fish taco I suggest you find your way over here. -

Came here for tacos. It's a hidden neighborhood gem with great vibe and great food. The owner recommended a few things we wouldn't usually order -octopus and stuffed pepper- which were awesome! 

Will be back for $2.50 fish taco special on Mondays and Tuesdays. They're also working on a liquor license for beer and wine so can see this becoming the happy hour spot in the future. 

Support local small business!
Food was delicious.. service was great !! I had the fish taco special!! Good portion for your buck ... will recommend and will be back soon!

Sooo gooooood! Never know whether to trust reviews but this place is such a gem. Amazing AUTHENTIC food. Fish tacos are wonderful. Fresh tasting and good texture. Service was friendly and helpful. Horchata was the best I've ever had. Eat here.

Finally got to check this place out I've driven past it soooo many times 

It's a cool color with an octopus painted on the side so you can't miss it lol .... it's kind of small inside it was just me when I came in but it was early when they first opened 

I was greeted right away by very friendly staff I'm going to assume he might of been the owner 

It was Tuesday so they do 2.50$ shrimp tacos grilled or fried :) who doesn't like a deal?????  I got one grilled .... the staff was friendly with helping me make choices on what else to try I got a pulpo taco and a goberndor taco (not sure if I spelled it correctly) I took mine to go I didn't eat there I also ordered a horchata which was very yummy they make it fresh there which is always nice 

My food was made and I was about my way All for under 15$ heyyyyyy 

I got home quickly sat down and took a bite of each one each one were so delicious with there own flavors and spices :) 

The governdo was probably my favorite one but all of them are equally yummy if your  havnt been to this place you are missing out completely skip the chains and support your local businesses
This place is awesome. Best seafood tacos ever! Even got the octopus tacos right. Highly recommended.

I was so grateful to find this gem while getting gas next door.  I am not from Vegas and was dreading the process of finding meal in the casinos and dealing with that ordeal.  Nothing around the area looked promising - all fast food.  Then I happened on this place (thank you, Yelp), and felt like I had a guardian angel.  Service was fast and friendly and the creations were creative and elegant.  Far surpassed my expectations and now I have a go-to place for next time I hit sin city.

YUUUMMMMMM!!!! So delish! We are fish taco critics, and these by far are some of the best fish tacos we've had throughout the world (that's not a type-o, yes I wrote WORLD). If you come in when Manny's working, you're in for an even greater treat with his attention to detail in service.  Try the octopus fritters, if you like calamari you will like these too. The location is easy to find right on Las Vegas Blvd., just north of the Stratosphere. Prices are very reasonable too.  Don't miss out, you won't be disappointed!

Positively the best, tastiest, and freshest seafood dishes in town.  Just passing through on our way to Utah for our first day of an epic road trip, and this little gem does NOT disappoint!  We had fish tacos & tostadas, and do not leave this place without ordering The Gobernador Taco or you'll not have experienced one of the most creative tacos you'll ever eat EVER.  Cozy, clean, and ask for Manny he'll take care of you!  Way to go, Bajamar!

Do you dream about swimming in the ocean and eating all those tasty fish around you like me? If you do...or if you're ready to begin, then this is the place for you, with Baja-Mexican flavor at a great price!

When you walk in, you are greeted by the welcoming smile of Manny, the owner. You can sit at the bar or at one of the tables and begin to peruse the delicious menu. The menu is straight forward, one side is in English, and the other in Spanish. On it you will find several Baja-style seafood options, including some amazing seafood tacos!

When my love first brought me here, we knew right away we would be coming back. All-in-all, we have ordered:

- Pulpo Enchilado Taco
- Shrimp (raw) Tostada
- Marlin Taco a Las Brasas
- Seafood Soup
- Bajamar Fish Taco
- Camaron Enchilado Taco
- Gobernador Taco
- Carne Asada Taco

My favorite was the Pulpo Enchilado Taco but everything was made fresh and tasty. Chef makes a "Chipotle Mayo Sauce" that is spread on top of several of the tacos. If your friend is not in the mood for seafood?...not a problem. Chef can make Carne Asada Tacos as well. They are not on the menu, but Bajamar Seafood & Tacos will accommodate the request. 

Their Tacos are not small, street tacos. They are big enough to just have two for lunch, but you'll probably want to have a third, just because it's that good. They have a few beers on tap, and offer a couple of Mexican drinks, like Hibiscus Lemonade Aqua Frescas, to quench your thirst...so refreshing!  

Make a point to try Bajamar...who knows...we might even see you there.

-2018 review #9-

Manny and his crew are super friendly and accommodating.  My boys and I were visiting from CA this past weekend and we ran across this place and decided to try.  We asked Manny what was the best menu item and he recommended the Pulpo or Octopus.  We didn't go for it and ordered everything from shrimp to carne asada.  We also ordered a few appetizers and were pleasantly surprised.  When the rest of our tacos came we quickly devoured them and they were fresh, crisp and delicious.  We then knew if the rest of the tacos were that good, we should try the octopus.  4 of us ordered the octopus and they were so good.  The octopus was tender and the accompanying sauce and trimmings just melt in your mouth.  These are the best seafood tacos in Vegas.  We ended up eating here everyday of our trip and making good friends with Manny and his crew.

Highly recommended! Bajamar is the perfect foodie stop if you're traveling North on The Strip up to the Arts District/Fremont Street area. I ordered the fish tacos, grilled and the chipotle sauce is mouth watering. There was no guacamole on the menu but they whipped some up for me on the spot the way I like it with lots of cilantro, fresh avocados and easy on the onions. Service was top notch. I love the décor of surfboards and Baja California beach art, like a Baja seaside food shack had been uprooted and transplanted on the Las Vegas Strip.

Tried this place for the first time today, it was really good! The staff was super friendly and helpful with choosing an dish. Restrooms were clean! I recommend trying the aguachilie verde, super sour because the lime is used to cook the shrimp. Also the surf and turf fries were delicious! Would love to try more items.
This place is the best in town for sea food. If you want feel in Baja and eat real Mexican sea food this is the place.
Great Tacos!!!!! Friendly Faces, Good Prices. Love the Pulpo de enchilada and the Fish Tacos!!!! Excellent. Great hibiscus Lemonade. All very yummy and reasonable. I will be back!!!!
This place gives the Taco/Mariscos places in Los Angeles a run for their money. Amazingly fresh and super affordable. Definitely worth a stop if you're in Vegas.
We found this place for light dinner when we were staing Las Vegas. Good fish taco, and very nice service. Must go place!
Delicious  I got the Lucas taco and loved it. Very clean inside and the server was nice. Don't be afraid to get a little bit messy in here when you eat, the tacos are stuffed!

We were a little skeptical, but yelp led us to a fantastic place! The fish tacos were nothing short of amazing! I was disappointed that they didn't have alcohol, but the food was so awesome$!we will be back!
Awesome customer service, easy parking... Manny was super helpful and patient with suggestions and recommendations.... came for the fish tacos.. I'll be back for the octopus and shrimp.

Went here for the first time for a friend's birthday a week ago. I will definitely be returning. The food is excellent. The food is fresh and the flavors are on point. You can taste the individual ingredients. I enjoyed a Mixteco tostada and a Pulpo taco recommended by our waiter. 
Comfortable atmosphere and attentive service. You can't beat the price. On the strip, easy to reach. Local favorite.

Attention: This is not just another taco shop. Tacos el Gordo is delicious, but Bajamar is not in competition with them or any other Mexican food joint. Unless I missed something on the menu, they don't serve anything but seafood. No asada. No pastor. 

We tried the Lucas Taco, the Pulpo (octopus) Enchilado Taco and the horchata. The food is beautiful to look at, scratch made, and very fresh. The Lucas is basically a chile relleno in a tortilla with grilled shrimp on top. The horchata takes two days to make and is very tasty.

I just INHALED three grilled shrimp tacos from Bajamar. It's right down the street from my house, and it's going to be a problem. 

Decently priced, quick and very friendly service, and the best fish tacos in Vegas. I'm so hooked. See what I did there? 

This is my third visit, and each time I've left super happy and satisfied. I've had both grilled and fried shrimp tacos, and some of their fish tacos which were all equally amazing. Their horchata is a bit too sweet for my liking, but don't let that stop you from ordering it. The sauce they put on the tacos isn't too heavy and overpowering and lets the rest of the flavors come through. I'm so excited to have this gem in Downtown Las Vegas!

OMG!!!! This place is amazing! I can honestly say this is the best seafood joint I've ever tried... the aguachiles rojos are amazing. As well as the octopus tacos. Their surf and turf fries are soooo good too!!! I'll definitely be back soon. Maybe even for dinner today.  great customer service as well. Owner is awesome and friendly!

Nice new restaurant !
Delicious food ! We enjoyed the Lucas tacos, burrito, chicken tenders and homemade cheesecake.
Manny was very helpful, friendly and attentive.
Must try when you are in the area !
Best fish tacos in Vegas (octopus, marlin, tilapia). Killer horchata. Excellent version of Mexican cheesecake and the Hibiscus lemonade rocks!

I've been hittin this spot for about 6 months now and I refused to tell anyone about it because I hate when my favorite spots become so popular they're virtually inaccessible. But Manny is such a good host, I can't keep quiet anymore. And to see how so many others love this place I have to give the credit. I'm here at least once a week. I love the pulpo( octopus) and marlin (marinated tuna) taco. The only thing is I wish the tacos were served in taco holders because the fillings can make the taco shell a little softer than what I like. And I wish they were open on Sundays!!!! But neither of these 2 are going to stop me from getting my taco fix!

Off the strip, plenty of parking. Walked in and order. And it was delicious and fresh!
Will be coming back soon!
Tacos del Gobernador tacos de pescadotacos de camarón 
And the aguas frescas hibiscus lemonade was amazing!
Overall customer service was excellent!

Had the regular fish taco, a shrimp and marlin.
Really really good. Although good, my least favorite was their regular  fish taco which is lightly fried tilapia. 
My favorite was the marlin, but apparently the octopus is their top taco.  I'm not big on octopus, so I didn't have it.  
My only suggestion is that they should get a couple of different fish varieties instead of  tilapia . Like ono or mahi mahi. A little more variety and this place would 5 Star  !

Omg the BEST SEAFOOD TACOS OMG!!!!!!!!!!!!!
I had the bajamar tacos to bomb if your looking for bomb seafood tacos come Here !!!!!!!
I never even liked fish tacos until I came here and now I dream about them. It's all I want to eat.

This is definitely a hidden little gem of Vegas!

To start off, the place feels like home. 
The service provided was very generous and polite, it's very rare to find service like this in Vegas. The waiter, which I believe was one of the owners; he was extremely attentive to our wants.. which we did order a bunch of food. He also provided a taste of background with the meal, which is a bonus. Overall the hospitality was outstanding.

The food was remarkably fresh and delicious! Also very affordable. From the handmade tortillas to the creamy sauce on the seafood tacos, the effort on plating was present and not forced. The combination of flavors were perfectly synchronized. There beverages are homemade as well. I can go on for a couple more paragraphs, but you definitely need to try this place if you have a taste for seafood! Or just love food!

Overall, it was overwhelmingly satisfying. I will definitely be coming back for some more!
I always passed by this place and its right next yo my work.  Decided to give it a shot and I'm glad I did. Best fish tacos I've had since san Diego
Well done. Good people doing their best to provide food that they passionate about. Fresh all from scratch preparations. Among the best tacos in town.

The food was great! I was craving seafood and Bajamar definitely hit the spot! Our server was extremely friendly and made sure we attended. We will definitely be back for more, now that we have found a great seafood. Be sure to try the Shrimp cocktail and Horchata, Delicious!

I was in Las Vegas on a business trip and stumbled upon this great new taco place.  Upon entering, my first impression was how clean the restaurant is. We were immediately greeted by Manny, one of the owners who gave us a quick review of the menu. I chose to go with a grilled fish taco, grilled octopus taco, as well as a grilled shrimp taco. The food was prepared immediately and was outstanding. I highly recommend this location and look forward to returning here during my next business trip.

You will feel like you got transported to Cabo at this little dive down Las Vegas Boulevard, a little away from the shiny side of the Strip. But it will have been worth it to eat fresh tasting fish, shrimp, and octopus tacos, so much that you will be wondering what seas are near the desert.  Reasonably priced, and generous portions.  Can't go wrong here, but keep your wits about you at night, especially if you come alone...a tiny bit of a dicey neighborhood action.  But hey, that's the adventure of being off-Strip in Las Vegas!

Upon another visit. Everything was perfect. 
Horchata  (authentic) not too sweet and just enough cinnamon 
Pulpo enchilado taco -- MUST TRY!!!
Tostada Mixta -- fresh, zesty, and saucy!!!
Honestly the owner knows his stuff, works hard and you can taste it.

Best seafood taco spot in Vegas!
Besides the excellent staff, the food is fantastic. Loved their signature fish tacos. Got the grilled ones...so much flavor and perfectly filling. I'll be back soon.

BOMB AF!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! the Marlin taco was the best taco I've tried in three years. Aguachiles rojo brought tears to our eyes because it was so delicious. I want to move downtown so we can be closer to this amazing spot. Can't wait to come back!
Love this new option for healthy seafood downtown. Ordered takeout on the Yelp app, and it was ready by the time I got there. The fish tacos were excellent. I'll be a regular customer. Thanks, guys!
Hands down the best seafood tacos I have ever had. Everything about this place is spot on, from the music, food and service. It's perfect representation of SoCal food and vibe.

Wow! Just, WOW! Killer, fresh seafood tacos! Along with some chips, guacamole and a michelada, I enjoyed one of the shrimp options and the marlin. After contemplating life choices, I felt that a I needed one more to put me right where I needed to be and upon Manny's recommendation, I opted for the octopus. Amazing little taco joint on the strip but away from the tourists. If you don't eat here, you really need to contemplate your poor life choices.
Amazing food, fresh, and fast! The owner provides great service and will ensure you have a great meal!

Omg I just died and went straight to fish taco heaven!! This place is incredible and hits all the right spots for your authentic fish / shrimp / seafood cravings. The fish tacos are perfectly flavorful with a light crispy batter that melts in your mouth. I had the shrimp tacos that were battered and so damn amazing!!! Finished the tacos off with a vanilla-esque Horchata that was also divine and delicious. Truly a hidden gem with a nice chill ambience. Definitely will be coming back!!

I went because of all the reviews after I did a quick search on tacos in Las Vegas. Don't get me wrong, the food was good, but these aren't the cheap $1-2 tacos that people are saying. It costed $3.50 for a regular fish taco and increased in price from there. There wasn't any gorditas or any other foods that the reviews mentioned. I ended up getting the fish taco and shrimp taco. Both were really good, but it worth the price. Also they charge for water...

Overall, the food was good, but I felt tricked by all the reviews on prices and food availability.

WOW!  This little gem should be more on the radar of Las Vegas than it is.  

I showed up on a Wednesday night around 5:45PM and the place was completely empty.  I sat at the bar (no liquor license quite yet for this place, so I opted for a bottle of water), was treated with warmth and kindness from the manager who clearly was grateful for my business and served up really fantastic tacos. 

The taste of the two tacos I consumed were really fantastic and an explosion of flavors is something I will not soon forget.  The presentation was top notch and the quality was spectacular.  I am certain I would feel the same with whatever I consumed off their menu.  

The establishment is not large and the parking is limited in the front, but opens up on the back (near Luv-It Frozen Custard).  I was advised a liquor license for beer and wine are on the horizon.  Go have drinks someplace else and do yourself a favor and go eat here!

Their aguas frescas are only $1.50 and soooooo good!!!!! They should be more, but glad they're underpriced! I had the spicy shrimp taco and some other shrimp taco I don't remember what I got exactly but I'm sure all their food is bomb. Definitely the best fish tacos I've had!

If tacos are a game, then we have a winner. The winner.

Bajamar Seafood & Tacos is one of the newest establishments to grace the corner of Las Vegas Blvd and Wyoming. This intersection has surprisingly been a destination hosting many foodstuffs over the year. It was the birthplace of the Goodwich, the first home of Desyree's gelato, and a brief incubator for Chef Justin Kingsley Hall (now of the Kitchen at Atomic). It's still home to the institution known as Luv-It Frozen Custard, although I may have started to visit it beyond those years.

And now we have Bajamar, the pinnacle of Mexican seafood tacos as far as I've witnessed. Maybe I haven't been to Mexico, but I've had a few delightful tacos in San Diego (as recently as eight days ago), both of which are the previous stops of the gentlemen who are running this place. Compared to those experiences they're doing everything better (aside from one killer smoked fish taco).

I happened to show up on Tuesday. This and Monday are when they offer the namesake Bajamar fish tacos ($3.50) for a dollar discount (down to $2.50, making them a steal). These are the best fish tacos I've had, with white fish battered and fried to crispy and tender perfection. These golden-brown morsels are layered along with salsa, red cabbage, and a delicious chipotle cream sauce inside an oiled and heated corn tortilla (the same single tortilla prep as in all of the other tacos which I enjoyed). A squeeze of lime is nice but not necessary. There isn't really any heat unless you wanna use the bottled hot sauces which the server provides you even if you don't ask.

You can get by on the fish tacos alone, but then you'd be missing out on other taco treats. The Pulpo Enchilado ($4) comes with chile de arbol, packing some heat but not that much (even for relatively heat-sensitive palates like mine), some Monterey cheese, and more of that salsa fresca and red cabbage. Amazingly tender octopus, which you might almost forget is present unless you get the pieces with the suction cups. I think it was in one of those food shows on TV where I heard that leaving those on adds texture, and now I see what they meant.

Last up for lunch was the Lucas taco ($5). I wanted to try their sauteed shrimp, and it was cooked to the right texture. Although it has the standard orange-ish and white appearance if you clean it off - suggesting that it's not that special on its own - you'll get so much flavor from the gooey Monterey cheese, the chipotle cream sauce, and the intact longitudinally cut (aka sliced lengthwise) half of a California pepper (aka Anaheim pepper). No regrets with trying this one either.

(UPDATE 4/16/18: The $4 Marlin taco a las Bresas is also quite something. It's the kinda fish flesh that cooks up to resemble terrestrial meat in all the best ways. But it's still pescatarian-friendly. The $4 Gobernador is another great shrimp taco.)

I'd also read that the horchata ($1.50) is a steal of a deal, and CM Taylor was right. This mason-jar version is rich but never seems too sweet. Get these if you like the cinnamon-y, creamy Mexican drink. 

Bajamar left me with only one question in the end: do I clean only my fingers of the heavenly mess, or do I lick the plate too? Since there were other people around, I avoided the latter. Maybe next time I won't. And by next time, I mean next week.

Drive, don't run, to experience some of the best seafood tacos by far in town or anywhere else.

(P.S. Shout-out to beer buddy Justin, if you're reading this. You put this restaurant on my list.)

(P.P.S. No beer here, but that's not out of the norm.)

Awesome seafood.
Authentic fish tacos, awesome shrimp  and pulpo tostadas and the cocktails are excellent.
A must seafood place to visit when in Las Vegas
Good foodn good beer and friendly service a winning combination.
The 5 stars are deserved - clean, funky decor and fantastic fish tacos. Try the Lucas Taco, chili rellano  and shrimp.  As a native Southern Californian I know my Mexican food.

If you like seafood and tacos, this is the place to go! Been obsessed with their pulpo (octopus) tacos for awhile now. I literally daydream about the damn thing. There's a little bit of heat to them but the octopus is cooked perfectly every time--none of that chewy overcooked mumbo-jumbo. 

I usually order the house-made hibiscus lemonade to help balance out the intense flavors of the pulpo. The beverage is refreshing, delicious and just the right touch of sweetness.

To sum it up, this place is awesome. The service is on point and the food is what the kids call nowadays, FIREEEEE!!!

Sooo happy this place opened a short walk from my house downtown! Wow. Every taco is great.. Pulpo (octopus), shrimp, a couple different types of fried and grilled fish, all loaded with colorful cabbage and fresh salsa. $1 drinks. Two tacos and some beans and rice on the side are perfectly filling. Fun Cali decor and bright open atmosphere, along with some reggae jams create a great experience!  Must try!!!

This is an interesting place located next to super burrito.  I just felt like ceviche and figured they had it.

They did and it was small, but good.  The menu is limited and the prices (IMO) were high.  So high that I only had the one dish.  

I also had an ice tea for
Which they only had sugar ... I was the only one in the place which was kind of strange.  I dunno if this place can make it...

Had the pleasure of dining at this gem tonight. The food is fantastic! Tried the Tacos de Camaron and they did not disappoint. Manny is a genuinely friendly person/host. I highly recommend this place to anyone looking for a bite while out on the town.

Food is super fresh. This is right down the street from my boyfriends business and we loved the food! I had a shrimp cocktail, shrimp tacos and the surf and turf ( the only carne asada on the menu is on this appetizer only, fyi and the rest is fresh seafood). I promise you won't be disappointed

We were just looking for a quick bite to eat while site seeing. This is a nice little spot right on Las Vegas Blvd. Very clean inside..  Service was great and timely. The food was amazing! Definitely have to return.

This is a small taco joint.  I always enjoy new places close to Downtown Las Vegas.   The place is clean and nice considering the age of the building.  The food was excellent.   Had the shrimp tostada that was more of a shrimp cocktail on a tostada shell.  It was very taste but hard to eat.   The taco was better.   The fish tasted fresh and the taco had a great mix of flavors.   I would not consider this place super cheap (lunch can run $15), but for fish it is very reasonable.   I would definitely return.

Bajamar Seafood & Tacos serves amazing fresh seafood. In a 6 day trip we've been back twice.  The food is affordable and so delicious.  I highly recommend the Gobernador Taco, Cameron Taco, Tostado Mixta and the Mixta Soup.  Generous portions, well seasoned, soup is made from scratch while you wait.  Staff and the owner are charming and so welcoming.  Worth the Uber from the strip.

Yes yes yes, this is the perfect fish taco!  Anyone craving baja style fish tacos this is the spot. Mon and Tues 2.50 fish taco special. Friendly service and fish taco perfection, this place is Baja done right. Right here in downtown LV. Thank you Bajamar, I'll be back at least once a week. I miss you Ensenada but now there's no rush to get back.  The only thing that could have made the experience better was if I had Mexican cerveza to wash it down. But they had Mexican coke and I was on my lunch break so no complaints here.

Only game in the city for this fare. If you've ever been to fishers in Mexico Bajamar is a us version of that. It's great. Give it a try. It's worth it. I hope to see Peruvian ceviche (dorado) for my next visit.

Clean and nice spot! Tacos are delicious! Don't expect the typical Mexican tacos so please don't think they are overprice. I think the prices are pretty fair for the type of food you get. Service is great!

Great recipes!!! Shrimp cucarachas off the hook. I've had a couple different seafood tacos and they're all REALLY good. Pulpo tostadas bomb. The fish ceviche was okay, needed a little bit of doctoring up for me, but that's practically everywhere(for me)just add lime and the chile. Restaurant and restrooms are very clean. Food is fresh and doesn't have that fishy smell. I thought the prices were on par with seafood. I been eating seafood for a very long time and it ain't never cheap (Mexican seafood or any) not even in the hood. Employee or owner maybe?seem to really care about service also, another plus. Guacamaya hot sauce. Will eventually go back for more

Bro.....and girls. This place is a hidden gem. The tacos are really fresh and the ingredients are quality. The prices are so low i felt almost guilty, the service is awesome and home like AND the best Horchata i've ever had. I'll be back when i'm in close by. Thanks guys.

We had the Camaron Enchilado, and it was just as advertised, if not better. We also had  the Shrimp Tostada's and the first thing that you taste is this lemony/citrusy flavor followed by a kick if spice when biting into the shrimp. You have an option to have ayour shrimp raw or cooked. W chose to cooked, and might I say it was amazing! The horchata is homemade and taste just like arros con leche (Rice & milk), a Mexican dessert dish. All in all my experience here was great!

These guys serve really tasty tacos. The place is small and friendly. The food was freshly prepared and the restaurant is clean. They offer a good variety of meats and seafood options. I recommend this spot for some quick bites but parking can be tricky!

DOWNTOWN WINS AGAIN. 

I frequent many restaurants in downtown Las Vegas and I am glad to add Bajamar to the list. I ordered the fish tacos thinking for a seafood taco spot this should be a strong item to start with and I was not wrong. The fish was well battered and the taco was texturally well balanced. I also ordered the Hibiscus Lemonade and it the type of drink you want to order every time you visit. To top it off Bajamar has a friendly staff and enough seating options to bring a large group of friends if needed. Thankful for the experience.

We make a bi-weekly trip for some fresh seafood, which is hard to find in the desert! Everything I've had has been fresh and delicious, and never leaves me feeling like crap. I've tried 2/3 aguachiles, a couple tostadas, mixed seafood cocktail, and most of the tacos - can't go wrong with anything on the menu! Also, Manny, the owner, is super accommodating and busts his ass. Our go-to taco place in town for sure.

Came here for a quick stop cheap eat because of the straight 5-star reviews, and now I gotta chip in another one. Honestly would give this place 10 out of 5 stars.
Great food, great service, fast and efficient.
The waiter (maybe owner?) is kind, friendly and honest about his recommendations. 
So cheap yet so good. Atmosphere is done very well too. Clean bathrooms.
As a designer I'm really impressed by how well done this place is for a low budget location. Definitely worth the walk from Stratosphere.

For drinks, we ordered the Horchata and Hibiscus Lemonade, both drinks which are made here in the restaurant. 100% would recommend.
For food, we got the fish taco, octopus taco, battered shrimp taco and the appetiser that was second from the top on the menu (forgot the name). 100% would recommend the tacos. The potato fries dish was tasty, but a little too heavy for me because of the cheese and sour cream.
These tacos are fabulous! I highly recommend this restaurant.staff is wonderful and very pleasant!!

You will not be disappointed. Some of the best tacos I've had in Vegas. It's a hidden gem. I visited twice in one day. I didn't want the food to end!! I will be telling all my friends about this spot and bringing all our visitors here.
Absolutely Awesome Tacos! Shrimp Tacos w Lucas Were My Favorite! I Was Looking For A Mexican Vegan Restaurant And I Think I Lucked UP Going Here Instead. I Will Definitely Be Going Back With Friends.

"Taste The Waves..."

Bajamar is a colorful family oriented restaurant located north strip closest to DTLV. The restaurant is extremely clean, staff very hospitable and the bar is massive. I didn't have a huge appetite when I stopped by a few days ago; therefore after a short debate I ordered one Baja Fish Taco $2.50 (perhaps a special) one Lucas Shrimp Taco $5.00 and a Side order of rice and beans $2.00 each. The fish taco was okay probably my least favorite. The Lucas taco was definitely better although it fell apart super fast and the rice was pretty bland.

If your feeling adventurous surfboard your way into this seafood friendly restaurant and create your own experience.

This was our first time here and it was absolutely delicious! my boyfriend and i are new to the area and we've been trying new places and this one will definitely be on our list of favorites!! the service was great , and Manny was the man! the food was amazing. you have to try it!

Bajamar translates for those that are not familiar with Spanish to ~  Low Tide.

Fear not as there is nothing low or substandard in this establishment from the amazing food, fantastic price point and outstanding service.  With roots from San Diego 

Of the dishes I've had:

The Pulpo Enchilado: (octopus)
Sauteed pulpo with chile de arbol, Monterey cheese, red cabbage and salsa fresca. 
5/5 my favorite :)

Lucas Taco:
Monterey cheese, grilled California pepper, sauteed shrimp and chipotle cream sauce.
4/5 *

* Flavorful unfortunately it fell apart on me after sitting for 4 minutes while I consumed the Pulpo Enchilado.  

Shrimp Tostada
Raw or cooked shrimp, salsa fresca, lime juice and avocado.
4.75/5

Bajamar Fish Taco
Battered tilapia, salsa fresca, red cabbage and chipotle cream sauce
4.75/5


Some of the best seafood tacos/ tostadas in town.  Manny (owner)  is super personable and gives service above and beyond.  The pride he takes in his business you can see in every interaction and dish served. 

I foresee many happy returns to Bajamar in my future and hopefully yours.

We stopped because of the yelp reviews. It was wonderful. I had the Bajamar taco. They are a 1.00 off on Monday and Tuesday. I also jade a shrimp taco. They were both delicious. It was clean and the staff friendly and the service was quick.
Foods are so good and not expensive. The guy is so nice! He recommended many foods and places. We really had a good time here!

Probably the best tacos I have ever had and I eat a lot of tacos! Great little restaurant with fresh food, amazing flavor and great service. Stop in to see Manny. He will take care of you and make sure you get exactly what you want! 

Don't be shy to try the octopus taco. I have had octopus before that is real tough and chewy, but Manny's is so tender with so much flavor. I did not want to stop eating it was that delicious! You won't be disappointed and I can't wait to get back!!

Good food all made there and the Service was excellent very friendly . The pricing  really isn't too bad either and the horchata Is made fresh!!!!  I didn't think I was going to enjoy it as much as I did and the place is clean !!!!!

Wow, this place is amazing! The food is so good! I got the Tostada Mixta. The best I have ever had by far. The Bajamar fish taco is so delicious. The people are so friendly. Everything is so clean. Highly highly recommended this place. I will come back here again when I come back to Vegas!

Ah..the near religious experience of the perfect taco! And to add to the wonderfulness (is that a word?, well it fits) they specialize in seafood.  

The place is small, but clean, open, and airy. The turnover is quick so there's not a wait even when they're busy. Our server/host/busboy was quick, efficient, friendly, and responsive.

We had the Bajamar shrimp tacos, the pulpo enchilado, and the Lucas taco. The shrimp taco had perfectly battered talapia, red cabbage, salsa fresca, and a wonderful cream salsa which all combined to make a tortilla envelope of goodness. The pulpo enchilado consists of sautéed octopus in a chili de arbol sauce, Monterrey cheese, salsa fresca, and a tasty and smooth chipotle cream sauce. The taco was incredible but the octopus kind of gets lost in everything, so I might have to sample this taco many many times to make up my mind. The Lucas taco is the specialty here and once you sample one you'll see why. Sautéed shrimp combined with grilled bell pepper, Monterrey cheese, and chipotle cream sauce make a scrumptious titanic taco. These are not huge tacos, pictures don't do them justice, but they are dense and tightly packed with amazing flavor and are highly satisfying.

I'm playing catch up with my reviews and really wanted to knock this one off my list first.

Bajamar occupies the old Chinese spot by OG's and Viva las Arepas. I had always wondered who or what was going to take up residency here and I'm glad it's this place! 

We came in on a random afternoon during lunch time. There's not a ton of table, but there is a very long, shiny wood bar to sit at too. The place is beautifully redone. We opted for the bar and were immediately greeted by the owner and were given menus and some ice waters. I ordered the shrimp tostada and the tostada mixta, which has shrimp, octopus and fish. My forever partner in crime ordered the fish taco special. We made small talk and found out that the owner is originally from the SD area and that there's only 3 people running the show there. 

Our food arrived shortly after and I actually had the restraint to stop and take a few photos beforehand, which is a miracle because I wanted to dive right in. The tostadas were crisp underneath the giant piles of shrimp, octopus and fish. The seafood was incredibly fresh, light and super chunky! Perfect. There's hot sauce available on the table caddy, along with a paper towel roll, s & p. I didn't try the fish tacos, but they looked fantastic and were reported to be delicious as well. Nicely sized pieces of golden fried fish atop corn tortillas and a fresh slaw to finish it off. 

We left super satisfied and are looking forward to our next visit in!

I noticed this restaurant earlier this week when dining at another establishment near by. I'm so glad I came back by! What a gem right on the strip. When walking in, the restaurant is modern and clean. ZERO fish smell which is incredible given the entire menu is seafood. We were greeted immediately, and food and drinks came out very quickly. 

I had a shrimp taco and pulpo taco and shared a shrimp cocktail as well. When I ordered it I had no idea pulpo was octopus but let me tell you it was the most tender octopus I've ever had and was a flavor explosion! The tortillas were cooked perfectly so they actually held up against the yummy sauces on the tacos and were soft and crispy at the same time. 

I can't wait until I'm back in the neighborhood to visit again!

Food was delicious we order aguachile and shrimp tacos , we loved it .. and their horchata is fresh made ( amazing ) ... will definitely be back soon .. I recommend this place 100% !! You won't be disappointed..

Great food at a great price ! The mixed seafood tostada and the pulpo tacos were my favorite! They make their own horchata in house for only $1.50 - a steal ! 
Very clean and beautifully decorated. 
Can't wait for them to get their wine&beer license and pair that with my food ! 
Thank you for opening this awesome seafood spot !

Great food, octopus tacos and shrimp tacos were really good. shrimp cocktail was delicious too. The horchata water very good too. This is a 5 stars no doubt and a must place to go when in Vegas. Definitely will come back.
We had the fish, shrimp, octopus and marlin tacos. All amazing, fresh and fast. My favorite was the fried fish and the tender spicy pulpo. Love the beach shack decor too. Can't wait to go back.
Reviewers got this one right!!! different delicious tacos I ordered a second round delicious!

AMAZING fish tacos! The one in the picture is the BajaMar beer battered fish taco (which you can also get grilled).  They were the perfect size and deliciously topped with chipotle crema, repollo, and salsa fresca. The hisbiscus (Jamaica) water was just the right amount of sweet & tart. The perfect ending to our meal was the homemade cheesecake which was suggested by the restaurant manager, Manny - who was also great conversation and all around nice guy. Definitely going back!

The server was attentive and good natured. We ordered cold beer, hot tacos (special fried fish $2.50 all day Monday and Tuesday) and the shrimp cocktail. The food was great and there is ample parking. I will be going back for sure.

This place is so cute!!! I discovered it while on my way to Cashman centre and it looked better than the stores surrounding it. "Seafood" and "tacos" are two words to get my attention. Me and my boyfriend stopped by and it's so nice inside and the portions are big! Everything is fairly priced for it being seafood and the drinks are cheap! Lemonade and horchata are $1.50 each!!

Best fish tacos in Las Vegas!!!! We ordered the Bajamar Fish Taco and the Gobernador Taco. The Bajamar was great, but the Gobernador was outstanding!!! I even ordered two more! We also had the hibiscus lemonade and the horchata. Both were homemade and great!!! The owner Manny was very friendly and helped with menu suggestions. Can't  wait to go back!!!

Mexican food is usually not my first choice for dinner. However, fish taco in this 110 degree Las Vegas summer day sounded extremely appealing. Having driven by this place on many occasions, we decided to give it a try. And what a gem it is. It reminded me immediately of the taco places we went to in Baja, Mexico, vibrant and cheerful. It has 6 or 7 different Mexican and local Las Vegas beers on tap. The food, is no doubt the star. Ingredients are fresh and tasty. I chowed down the tacos, savoring the bright and powerful flavors. I'm no expert in Mexican food, but this place I will come back over and over again

Came here on the recommendation of a few neighbors. The space is small but modern and very clean, much nicer than the average hole-in-the-wall mariscos place. 

We got the cooked shrimp and mixed tostadas. They were loaded, had to break them up and finish with a fork. Could have used a little more avocado but still great for the price. Some of the best, most tender octopus "pulpo" I've ever had. I'll be coming back for that! 

Also got the bajamar fish taco and camaron enchilado taco, which had amazing flavor and homemade tortillas.  Horchata $1.50 and delicious. Prices and service very good, one of my new favorite spots downtown!

Fish tacos!! 

I think I may have found a fish taco spot that I will frequent!! 

The octopus chicharrón is a must and their dipping sauce had some heat!! 

The pulpo enchilado and the battered shrimp tacos were great. 

The horchata these guys make was so damn good you'll need a refill or two haha

The food was wonderful and was a great bargain.  Well worth the short walk from the stratsphere.  

I will be going back the next time in Vegas

Could not recommend enough! We live a few blocks over and have been seeing everybody rant and rave about Bajamar in our neighborhood Facebook group. Decided to check it out and we were thoroughly  impressed. Manny was so nice and the food was delicious. We each had 3 tacos and a drink and our bill came out to $25. Very reasonable for the quality of food you are getting. Will be going back to try other things on the menu. 
Side note: fish tacos are $2.50 on mondays and tuesdays

Another great experience at Bajamar! I ordered my favorite fish taco which was outstanding and tried the camaron enchilado taco. The camaron(shrimp) is  my new favorite! Why is it my favorite? Because I Love it! The shrimp was most excellent and I liked the slight crunchiness of the actual tortilla. 
Yummy yummy yummy!

Two tacos and fresh lemonade for only $8.65! I'm full and happy!

You must go have lunch or dinner soon, you'll be glad you did!

EXCELLENT, EXCELLENT, EXCELLENT!!!
Authentic Mexican Seafood at its finest with  in my opinion, the best Pulpo (Octopus) dishes in Las Vegas as well as the fish chicharrones! Our food came to us fairly quick which was freshly cooked and hot as soon as it was prepared! The service was outstanding with all the bases covered which made our experience that much more enjoyable! A MUST to try in which you will not be disappointed, again thank you very much!

Tradition when I leave Vegas calls to have a pair of tacos , I changed my mind this time for some seafood and it was a great choice . Small location with ample parking , quick service and amazing food. I had the Lucas taco, fish taco and camarón to try a little bit of everything . The crunchy beer batter is seasoned perfectly and the chipotle dressing compliments these tacos with a little squeeze of fresh lime that quickly transports back to my nostalgic childhood visiting Ensenada . I will definitely be back when I return , keep up the great work!

Fantastic food, service and establishment. Walked pretty far to find this little gem. Well worth it. Delicious seafood tacos. Wonderful horchata. Super clean restaurant and our server was one of the nicest people I've meet in a while. Wish we lived here so I could visit this restaurant often. Keep on being amazing.
Outstanding seafood tacos! Healthy, great tasting and great value for money!!! Loved the Gobernador taco and shrimp tostada

Unbelievable food and service! Everything about this place is perfect. I had the Lucas taco and the octopus taco. They didn't skimp on ingredients or flavor. Everything is made fresh and to order and you can tell the difference.  Try the hibiscus lemonade. It was so refreshing!

This place is the bomb! I had the Bajamar fish tacos, extra crispy. They were delicious. Fish was  breaded perfectly. Not too heavy and not too light. The tacos were light and filling. Fresh ingredients, very fast service! I tried the hibiscus lemonade and it was interesting in a good way. Taco Tuesday specials! I'll be back...often!

From the moment I walked in I liked the place, then I tried the food and I was in love.

There is a small parking lot right in front of Bajamar off Las Vegas Blvd. It can be a bit tight, and a few transients have been sighted, but it makes for a great show when you're having lunch or dinner. I was greeted immediately when I walked in and sat at the bar. I thought about getting food to-go, but a few regulars (yes, they already have them) enticed me to stay and dine. I'm so very glad I did.

I was walked through the menu, which is in English on one side - Spanish on the other, and wanted to try everything. The service was top-notch. Very attentive and I could tell that he sincerely wanted me to have a great experience. I went with the Bajamar Fish Taco and Lucas Taco. Pause here as I take a moment of silence for these tacos.

The Bajamar taco was fresh, battered just enough, and packed with flavor. The Lucas Taco blew my mind. The gentleman sitting next to me recommended it because he has ordered it everyday since they opened. That's commitment!! It did not disappoint. I want to make a baby with that chipotle sauce. They make their own horchata and it was amazing. I'm not an expert, but it was creamy, not too sweet. I loved it. 

I took a chance and ordered the cheesecake to go. This was more of a 3-star cheesecake and wasn't decorated with fruit or any type of sauce like I was expecting based on other photos. I had one bite at home, tossed the rest. I might give it one more chance during my next trip, but only because I love cheesecake so much. It will be better for my belly if I don't like it anyway. Plus, more room for Lucas Tacos!!!

Absolute BEST shrimp and fish tacos I've had in Vegas. Great prices, great presentation and service is top notch too. Manny is very friendly and truly cares about his customers. Try all of the tacos here. You will not be disappointed. Pro tip: there's a hot sauce you have to ask for that they make in house. Get it. I will definitely be back soon! Glad Vegas finally has a legit seafood taco spot.

Wow, best fish tacos I've had in Vegas. Besides going to San Diego or Mexico, good fish tacos are hard to find. This place does not disappoint. 

This spot used to be a bizarre Chinese food/donuts place. I know, weird. So when I saw this was being remodeled, I was hoping it would turn into something decent. I was wary to try at first, but after some friends recommended I had to try. I'm glad I did. I didn't try a thing that I didn't like. And the hibiscus lemonade is delicious. I'll be sure to try the horchata next time. 

The decor in here is nice. The spot is small but packs a mighty punch. This needs to be in your taco rotation. And the prices are excellent. Don't be afraid of the parking lot, eat the tacos!

Very happy with this downtown find! Ordered through eat 24, ready as expected, no issues. We tried the Bajamar fish tacos with rice and beans. Very tasty, fresh and flavorful! Just wish the rice has a kick to it or some added spice, seems like something is missing. Big plus is the decent portion size for the price. I will be a returning customer, would like to dine in next time.
Hands down the best fish tacos in Vegas. The reviews are true so I don't have anything else to say other than to give it a try!
